All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
AIAgent
AIAgents are bits of logic that effect a single object in the game.
BasicAIAgent
AIAgents are bits of logic that effect a single object in the game.
BasicGame
Games require a main game loop to run along with game components that need to be run every game cycle.
BasicGameObject
A game object has its own physical position within the world, and a DrawListener to draw it each frame.
BasicKeyMapper
The default KeyMapper works by creating an array the size of the maximally supported keycode value and storing the resulting enum values at each keycode index.
BasicMenu
The BasicMenu class implements the Menu interface.
BasicMouseListener
The BasicMouseListener is a simple implementation of the GameMouseListener which only pays attention to mouse presses and mouse releases.
BasicPhysical
A simple implementation of the Physical interface which can be used to cut down on development time.
BasicPhysicsEngine
The PhysicsEngine has a list of all the objects currently in the world and checks every logic cycle whether any are currently colliding.
BasicScene
The Scene object is a collection of objects, AIAgents, and a physics engine.
Collidable
An object that can have collisions with other collidable objects.
DrawListener
A DrawListener is registered with a Graphics system and called on every frame to check if something needs to be drawn.
DrawListener.Priorities
The priorities that a drawing listener can be called at.
ElasticCollider
An ElasticCollider is a collider which results in perfectly elastic collisions.
Game
Games require a main game loop to run along with game components that need to be run every game cycle.
GameEngine
A collection of static methods that are used to make starting, closing and managing a game easier.
GameEngine.Window
An enum of pre-defined resolutions to open a game window at.
GameKeyListener
The GameKeyListenerInterface is an object that responds whenever a key is pressed
GameLogicThread
A thread used to run game logic once every 1/60th of a second.
GameMouseListener
A GameMouseListener is an extension of the MouseListener which includes an active position, attached frame, and getEvents() method.
GameObject
A game object has its own physical position within the world, and a DrawListener to draw it each frame.
GeneralLogger
The general logger prints all messages it receives to the console with ANSI color codes, a file located at ./logs/latest.log, and another file located at ./logs/'date'.log.
Graphics2d
A 2d graphics window that can be manipulated with the given methods.
Graphics2d.DrawImage
Represents an image to draw on the screen.
Graphics2d.Pixel
Represents a single pixel in 2d space with its own color and position.
GraphicsPanel
A graphics panel is used to draw graphics to the computer screen.
GraphicsPanelInterface
Implementations of GraphicsPanel likely need to extend JPanel so that they can be used to draw.
GraphicsThread
A thread used to refresh the graphics of a panel as fast as possible.
HitBox
Every collidable object needs a HitBox which defines when collisions occur.
JavaxSoundManager
The JavaxSoundManager is a SoundManager that outputs sound using the classes provided by javax and javax.sampled.
KeyMapper
The key mapper is used to map keys between their keycodes and the KeyValues enum.
KeyValue
Gives an enum value to the different key values.
Level
Levels for messages that are sent to loggers.
Logger
Loggers receive messages from the running program at various levels.
Menu
A menu is an object used by the player to select something, or modify the value of something.
Physical
Physical objects are objects which contain a velocity, acceleration, position, and mass.
PhysicsEngine
The PhysicsEngine has a list of all the objects currently in the world and checks every logic cycle whether any are currently colliding.
Scene
The Scene object is a collection of objects, AIAgents, and a physics engine.
SoundManager
The SoundManager is used to manage sounds being played to the player.
SquareHitBox
Every collidable object needs a HitBox.
StackGameKeyListener
The StackGameKeyListener creates a stack of pressed, and depressed events which are then accessed with accessor methods to be read by the game.
SugaThread
A thread in the SugaEngine is no different from a normal thread except that it has built in pause and stop values.
Vector
A vector can represent a velocity, acceleration, or position in 3d space.
